Gunfire forces LAPD helicopter to land
Sunday, April 24, 2011

VAN NUYS, Calif. -- Police didn't flush out a suspected shooter after firing tear gas into Van Nuys apartment buildings Sunday, in pursuit of an individual suspected of firing a gun at a police helicopter that was forced to land after taking fire. 


The Los Angeles Times reports residents of several apartment buildings were evacuated before police tried to smoke out the suspect.

One suspect, a 20-year-old, is under arrest. Detectives believe he used a rifle.

Police are investigating reports that two groups of suspects may have shot at the police helicopter at 6 a.m.


The helicopter had been responding to reports of gunfire when it came under fire.

Asst. Chief Earl Paysinger says the pilot of the aircraft was fortunate to have landed without injury after shots hit the copter's fuel tank.
